trans-unit.source: Specifies a print controller that sends information to a printer.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument> uses this class.
For more information on printing, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace overview.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController"></xref> class.
Completes the control sequence that determines when and how to print a page of a document.

<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> is called immediately after the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument> raises the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.PrintPage> event.

If an exception is thrown inside a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.PrintPage> event of a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument>, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> is not called.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> creates the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object that is sent to the printer.

After <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> is called, the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPage%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object to a graphic of a single page.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> method clears the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object, while the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPrint%2A> method deallocates the object.

When <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> is called from a printing context of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog> a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintingPermission> of <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintingPermissionLevel.SafePrinting> is required.
Printing to the default printer requires a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintingPermission> of <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintingPermissionLevel.DefaultPrinting>.
All other calls this method requires a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintingPermission> of <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintingPermissionLevel.AllPrinting>
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument"></xref> that represents the document being printed.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintPageEventArgs"></xref> that contains data about how to print a page in the document.
The native Win32 Application Programming Interface (API) could not finish writing to a page.
Completes the control sequence that determines when and how to print a document.

<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPrint%2A> is called immediately after <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument> raises the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.EndPrint> event.
Even if an uncaught exception was thrown during the printing process, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPrint%2A> is called.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> creates the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object that is sent to the printer.

After <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> is called, the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPage%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object to a graphic of a single page.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> method clears the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object, while the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPrint%2A> method deallocates the object.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument"></xref> that represents the document being printed.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintEventArgs"></xref> that contains data about how to print the document.
The native Win32 Application Programming Interface (API) could not complete the print job.
-or-
The native Win32 API could not delete the specified device context (DC).
Begins the control sequence that determines when and how to print a page in a document.

<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPage%2A> is called immediately before <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument> raises the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.PrintPage> event.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> creates the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object used in printing.

After <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> is called, the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPage%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object to a graphic of a single page.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> method clears the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object, while the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPrint%2A> method deallocates the object.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument"></xref> that represents the document being printed.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintPageEventArgs"></xref> that contains data about how to print a page in the document.
Initially, the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintPageEventArgs.Graphics"></xref> property of this parameter will be `null`.

The value returned from the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPage(System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument,System.Drawing.Printing.PrintPageEventArgs)"></xref> method will be used to set this property.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> object that represents a page from a <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument"></xref>.
The native Win32 Application Programming Interface (API) could not prepare the printer driver to accept data.
-or-
The native Win32 API could not update the specified printer or plotter device context (DC) using the specified information.
Begins the control sequence that determines when and how to print a document.

<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> is called immediately after <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument> raises the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.BeginPrint> event.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> creates the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object used in printing.

After <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> is called, the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPage%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object to a graphic of a single page.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> method clears the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object, while the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPrint%2A> method deallocates the object.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> verifies that the printer settings are valid.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument"></xref> that represents the document being printed.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintEventArgs"></xref> that contains data about how to print the document.
The printer settings are not valid.
The native Win32 Application Programming Interface (API) could not start a print job.
